sentence.Network_en: The scheme for building an airport seems to be completely defunct now.

sentence.Network_en: Most of the time of the defunct had been passed in helping himself.
sentence.Network_cn: 死者生前大部分时间都是用来造福自己.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'deceased'): from Latin defunctus 'dead', past participle of defungi 'carry out, finish', from de- (expressing reversal) + fungi 'perform'

entry.tran: 不再存在的;停止运转的;坏了的
entry.def: If something is defunct, it no longer exists or has stopped functioning or operating.

example.ex: ...the leader of the now defunct Social Democratic Party...
example.tran: 现已不复存在的社会民主党的领导人

example.ex: They bought all their equipment from a defunct brewery in Manhattan.
example.tran: 他们那些设备都是从曼哈顿一家已经关闭的啤酒厂购买的。

means.word_mean: 1. no longer in force or use; inactive;
2. having ceased to exist or live;
